title: Our Whispers
story: I create this application based on "every app won't complete without stories" thing. This app have basic feature of CRUD and it also had auth service with Firebase Auth.
challenge: This app is still in progress since the main feature is not implemented yet, which is posting image and video and delete it after 24 hours.

title: Capchiq
description: Only fans clone in React Native
story: I made this app out of curiosity about OnlyFans site. OnlyFans didn't have a native based app but they go with PWA instead. So I just think why I don't clone one in React Native?
challenge: Creating native application with RN is not easy. There is much boilerplate, unknown error, and third party package is needed especially for Video. RN doesn't have Video element (Expo does), so it is very challenging for me to get the video, upload it and show it on the timeline.

title: Travel Sumatra
story: I create this clone site because I want to sharpen my skills in animation. Animation always fascinate me. But it surely takes time to master it
challenge: Working with animation in React is not easy. Framer motion makes it simple and responsive too. I learn much of using React useContext API. If I going to do this again, I probably will using Redux Tool Kit instead of useContext.
todo: preserve canvas state when user change theme

title: Portfolio
story: I create this portfolio to showcase my projects and also blogging about what I learn or what I like to do when I'm not creating a beautiful app.
challenge: Page transition with Sapper is quite tricky. I can't make it work properly yet. So I combined it with GSAP to create smooth and simple page transition. Creating my first blog site with Sanity CMS is exciting. Sanity is a different beast. Setting up schema and using Sanity's GROQ is really a good developer experience. It is far simple than I tought it will be.
